dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.english: What do you study at the university?

dialog.speaker: Luis
dialog.spanish: Yo estudio ingeniería. Es una carrera difícil, pero interesante.
dialog.english: I study engineering. It's a difficult but interesting major.

dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.spanish: Entiendo. Yo estudio literatura. Me gusta leer y escribir.
dialog.english: I see. I study literature. I like to read and write.

dialog.speaker: Luis
dialog.spanish: Qué bien. Mi hermano va a la misma universidad y él estudia historia.
dialog.english: That's great. My brother goes to the same university and he studies history.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: La clase de español es muy interesante. ¿No crees?
dialog.english: Spanish class is very interesting. Don't you think?

dialog.speaker: Diego
dialog.spanish: Sí, lo es. La profesora es muy buena. Ella explica todo muy bien.
dialog.english: Yes, it is. The teacher is very good. She explains everything very well.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: Yo aprendo mucho en su clase. ¿Tú entiendes todo?
dialog.english: I learn a lot in her class. Do you understand everything?

dialog.speaker: Diego
dialog.spanish: Más o menos. La gramática es un poco difícil, pero yo repaso mis notas.
dialog.english: More or less. The grammar is a little difficult, but I review my notes.

questions.question: ¿Qué es un poco difícil para Diego?

dialog.speaker: Clara
dialog.spanish: Estoy en la biblioteca haciendo mi tarea. Es mucha.
dialog.english: I am in the library doing my homework. It's a lot.

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: Yo también. La tarea de matemáticas es muy larga. Yo no entiendo el último problema.
dialog.english: Me too. The math homework is very long. I don't understand the last problem.

dialog.speaker: Clara
dialog.spanish: Yo te puedo ayudar. ¿Tienes un examen esta semana?
dialog.english: I can help you. Do you have an exam this week?

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: Sí, yo voy a tener un examen el viernes. Yo tengo que estudiar mucho.
dialog.english: Yes, I am going to have an exam on Friday. I have to study a lot.

questions.question: ¿Qué significa 'Yo no entiendo el último problema'?
options: I don't like the last problem
I don't have the last problem
I don't understand the last problem
I don't want the last problem
questions.answer: I don't understand the last problem

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: La educación es muy importante. Yo aprendo algo nuevo todos los días.
dialog.english: Education is very important. I learn something new every day.

dialog.speaker: Eva
dialog.spanish: Sí, yo también. Me gusta leer sobre diferentes culturas. Es muy interesante.
dialog.english: Yes, me too. I like to read about different cultures. It's very interesting.

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: Yo prefiero aprender con videos. Mi cerebro aprende más rápido así.
dialog.english: I prefer to learn with videos. My brain learns faster that way.

dialog.speaker: Eva
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bien! Mi profesora dice que cada persona aprende de una manera diferente.
dialog.english: That's great! My teacher says that each person learns in a different way.

questions.question: ¿Qué es importante para Pedro y Eva?
¿Qué significa 'cada persona aprende de una manera diferente'?
options: Each person likes a different thing
Each person learns in a different way
Each person goes to a different place
Each person has a different book
questions.answer: Each person learns in a different way

sentences.spanish: Yo voy a la escuela todos los días. Mis clases son muy interesantes.
sentences.english: I go to school every day. My classes are very interesting.

sentences.spanish: Mi profesora de historia es muy buena. Ella nos enseña muchas cosas.
sentences.english: My history teacher is very good. She teaches us many things.

sentences.spanish: Yo estudio mucho para los exámenes. Siempre repaso mis notas en la biblioteca.
sentences.english: I study a lot for exams. I always review my notes in the library.

sentences.spanish: Mis amigos y yo siempre hacemos la tarea juntos. Nosotros nos ayudamos.
sentences.english: My friends and I always do homework together. We help each other.

sentences.spanish: A mí me gusta mucho la escuela. La educación es muy importante para mi futuro.
sentences.english: I really like school. Education is very important for my future.

sentences.spanish: Este semestre, yo estudio tres clases de matemáticas. Son muy difíciles.
sentences.english: This semester, I am studying three math classes. They are very difficult.

sentences.spanish: La tarea es muy larga y los exámenes son muy complicados. Yo no entiendo todo.
sentences.english: The homework is very long and the exams are very complicated. I don't understand everything.

sentences.spanish: Mi amigo me ayuda. Él es muy inteligente y él entiende todo.
sentences.english: My friend helps me. He is very intelligent and he understands everything.

sentences.spanish: Él y yo vamos a la biblioteca juntos para repasar las lecciones.
sentences.english: He and I go to the library together to review the lessons.

sentences.spanish: Yo sé que voy a aprender mucho. La educación es un camino largo, pero yo voy a tener éxito.
sentences.english: I know I am going to learn a lot. Education is a long road, but I am going to succeed.

sentences.spanish: Yo siempre he querido ir a la universidad. Es mi sueño.
sentences.english: I have always wanted to go to the university. It's my dream.

sentences.spanish: Mis padres siempre me dicen que la educación es la llave para el éxito.
sentences.english: My parents always tell me that education is the key to success.

sentences.spanish: Yo estudio mucho en la escuela. Mis clases favoritas son ciencias y literatura.
sentences.english: I study a lot in school. My favorite classes are science and literature.

sentences.spanish: Yo aprendo mucho sobre el mundo. Mis profesores son muy inspiradores.
sentences.english: I learn a lot about the world. My teachers are very inspiring.

sentences.spanish: Yo voy a ir a la universidad y voy a aprender todo lo que puedo.
sentences.english: I am going to go to the university and I am going to learn everything I can.

speaking.title: Hablando de la vida académica
speaking.description: Preguntas y respuestas para practicar conversaciones sobre la escuela, la universidad y los estudios.

question.english: What do you study?

answer.english: I study Spanish.

question.spanish: ¿Vas a la escuela o a la universidad?
question.english: Do you go to school or university?

answer.english: I go to the university.

question.english: Do you have a lot of homework?

answer.english: Yes, I have a lot of homework.

question.english: What is your teacher like?

answer.english: She is very intelligent.

question.english: What do you learn in your favorite class?

answer.spanish: Yo aprendo sobre la historia del mundo.
answer.english: I learn about world history.

question.english: Do you like to read?

answer.spanish: Sí, me gusta leer libros de ciencia ficción.
answer.english: Yes, I like to read science fiction books.

question.english: Where do you normally study?

answer.english: I study in the library.

question.english: Is your math class difficult?

answer.english: Yes, it is a little difficult.

question.spanish: ¿Qué vas a estudiar en el futuro?
question.english: What are you going to study in the future?

answer.english: I am going to study medicine.

question.spanish: ¿Qué vas a hacer después de la clase?
question.english: What are you going to do after class?

answer.spanish: Voy a ir a mi casa a hacer la tarea.
answer.english: I am going to go home to do homework.

question.spanish: ¿Cómo es la educación en tu país?
question.english: What is education like in your country?

answer.english: Education is very good.

question.spanish: ¿Qué aprenden los estudiantes en tu escuela?
question.english: What do the students learn at your school?

answer.english: They learn science and math.

question.english: Do you understand all the lessons?

answer.english: Yes, I understand almost everything.

question.english: Why is education important?

answer.spanish: Es la llave para tener un buen futuro.
answer.english: It is the key to having a good future.

question.english: Who do you study with?

answer.english: I study with my friends.

question.spanish: ¿Cuándo vas a repasar para el examen?
question.english: When are you going to review for the exam?

answer.english: I am going to review tomorrow.

question.spanish: ¿Qué leíste en tu clase de literatura?
question.english: What did you read in your literature class?

answer.spanish: Leí un libro sobre un viaje.
answer.english: I read a book about a trip.

question.english: What is the history homework like?

answer.english: The homework is very long.

question.english: What do you like to listen to in class?

answer.spanish: Me gusta escuchar al profesor y sus explicaciones.
answer.english: I like to listen to the teacher and his explanations.

question.spanish: ¿Qué vas a aprender en el próximo semestre?
question.english: What are you going to learn next semester?

answer.spanish: Voy a aprender sobre el arte.
answer.english: I am going to learn about art.
